item.title: Java Portfolio
item.description: Moore_Java_Portfolio A portfolio showcasing my Java skills, knowledge, and projects. Projects include scripting for games, object-oriented programming, and design. Some projects that I have worked on include Runescape automated player scripts and the back-end of a chat server using Java Sockets. Runescape Automated Player Scripts The Runescape automated player scripts helped with the understanding of: Java, Python, and C++ languages. Additional libraries used is Java Swing packages. More skills include API familiarity as I had to work with the games API as well as the automation client.
item.content:
Moore_Java_Portfolio

A portfolio showcasing my Java skills, knowledge, and projects. Projects include scripting for games, object-oriented programming, and design.

Some projects that I have worked on include Runescape automated player scripts and the back-end of a chat server using Java Sockets.

Runescape Automated Player Scripts

The Runescape automated player scripts helped with the understanding of:

  1. Java, Python, and C++ languages. Additional libraries used is Java Swing packages.
  2. More skills include API familiarity as I had to work with the games API as well as the automation client.
  3. Automation techniques and logic such as using scripts and navigating with the game’s mechanics and UI.
  4. Script design from the logic required from the automated plater.
  5. Data parsing from data collected from the game and using it to react with actions in the game.
  6. Anti-Automated Player awareness from making these automated players I’ve learned their advanced behavior and limitations of them.
  7. Debugging and testing from making sure the code generally works and works with new updates to both the game and the client.

These skills I believe are essential in any understanding of programming of games and apps.

Java Messaging Client

The Java Sockets chat server back-end has helped me develop the following skills:

  1. Advanced Java programming experience.
  2. Socket API that allowed me to create, manage, and communicate over network sockets. Includes server-side and client-side development.
  3. Network protocols understanding such as TCP/IP, sockets, ports and IP addresses, and differential layers of OSI models.
  4. Understanding of concurrency through multiple clients’ ability to join a chat server which developed skills in thread management, synchronization, and concurrent programming.
  5. Server architecture due to handling client connections, messaging routes, and data storage.
  6. Error handling and logging were developed through various potential errors including logging and debugging.
  7. API design through the building blocks of a RESTful API and handle HTTP requests and manage responses.

item.title: Data Science Portfolio
item.description: CS539 Final Project Description: The project to predict density of a tungsten based alloy using both regression type and classification based models as well as characterize trends and gather insight on fluence of features chosen had both insightful and shocking results. The challenge to predict ingot density, with a 70% cross-validated accuracy based on chemical properties, powder characteristics and basic processing parameters was seemingly successful using KNN, SVM, Random Forest and Decision Tree models.
item.content:
CS539 Final Project

Description:

The project to predict density of a tungsten based alloy using both regression type and classification based models as well as characterize trends and gather insight on fluence of features chosen had both insightful and shocking results. The challenge to predict ingot density, with a 70% cross-validated accuracy based on chemical properties, powder characteristics and basic processing parameters was seemingly successful using KNN, SVM, Random Forest and Decision Tree models. Among the successful models other insights derived included the influence of the time of year, trace elements outside primary elements and dataset complications.

Final Project Repository

item.title: SQL Portfolio
item.description: Query Optem Description: This project was the final project of my masters-level database management class. The project, titled Statistical Analysis of the Effect of Denormalization on Query Resource Consumption and Performance, covered the normalization of applicable TPC-H benchmark sets of queries and if there was a correlation to the resources required to complete the query. Some skills learned from this project is: Understanding of Normalizaiton and Denormalization. Advanced SQL Querying: writing and optimizing complex queries, using joins, subqueries, aggrates, etc.
item.content:
Query Optem

Description:

This project was the final project of my masters-level database management class. The project, titled Statistical Analysis of the Effect of Denormalization on Query Resource Consumption and Performance, covered the normalization of applicable TPC-H benchmark sets of queries and if there was a correlation to the resources required to complete the query.

Some skills learned from this project is:

  1. Understanding of Normalizaiton and Denormalization.
  2. Advanced SQL Querying: writing and optimizing complex queries, using joins, subqueries, aggrates, etc.
  3. Indexing: Identifying columns and combinations that can benefit from indexing to enhance query performance.
  4. Database Performance Tuning: understanding how storage mechanisms, IO operations, and in-memory processes impact query performance.
  5. Benchmarks: understanding the purpose and design of the TPC-H benchmark.
  6. Data Modeling: Translating real world data to database structures - modifying to fit denormalized techniques.

Check out the entire project page here: CS542 Final Project Manuscript
